titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Reah Frazer (1804-1856) was a prominent attorney and for many years a major political figure in Lancaster County, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of letters to Reah Frazer. The bulk of the letters concern county and national politics; many discuss the nomination of James Buchanan for president, and others discuss political meetings and appointments of candidates for local commissions, including requests for Frazer's assistance in obtaining posts. Other letters relate to Frazer's law practice. There are a number of letters from Frazer's brother, A. Carpenter Frazer.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Pennsylvania State Archives: Reah Frazer papers (manuscript group 53).
